article.headline: Stocks close higher as stimulus talks continue, with Nasdaq notching new high
article.body: Stocks closed modestly higher after a choppy trading session Tuesday, with investors keeping one eye on stimulus talks in Washington and another on mixed corporate earnings. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% gained about 166 points to close 0.6% higher, near 26,830, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% closed at 3,307, according to preliminary estimates, up 12 points or 0.4%. The tech-heavy Nasdaq COMP, +1.39% started off the day strong, slipped into the red, and rebounded late in the session to close 0.4%, 38 points, higher, near 10,941, another record close. Shares of Abiomed Inc. ABMD, +0.87% lost ground even after the company said its Impella heart pump had received an emergency use authorization from the FDA for use as a treatment for some COVID-19 patients. On Capitol Hill, a stimulus deal for the coronavirus-battered economy did not appear imminent.
